bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document

org.orgName: The United States Circuit Court, Northern Division, State of Washington

div1.ab: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT, SOUTHERN DIVISION Northern Division. STATE OF WASHINGTON.
In the matter of the application of F. S. Walton, for a writ of habeas corpus.
div1.p: To the Honorable C. H. Hanford, Judge of said Court: The petition of F. S. Walton respectfully shows that he is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by John G. Boyle, at North Yakima, in the county of Yakims, State of Washington. That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal, and that the illegality thereof consists in this, to-wit; your said petitioner is a resident of Portland in the state of Oregon, and is and has for a long time past been a citizen of said city of Portland and state of Oregon. That upon the fifth day of September, A.D., 1901, he proceeded upon a certain lot in the city of North Yakima, and within the incorporated limits of said city, which he had duly and regularly leased from the owner thereof for the purpose, to sell and to hawk and to vend a certain medicinal preparation known as "Quaker Botanical Herbs", the trade mark of which is "Quaker medicine" with the head and shoulders of a quaker, and the word "Company underneath same, a trade mark for which has long since been taken out in the United States Patent Office under the laws of the United States. That said medicine is composed of various vegetable preparations, the products of the soil in various parts of the United States, but it is not composed of any products of the soil or vegetables grown in the county of Yakima, State of Washington or at any other point in the state of Washington, but is exclusively composed of medical herbs and extractions thereof grown in various states of the United States other than the state of Washington. That on the said fifth day of September, A.D., 1901, whilst engaged in vending and hawking said preparations on a lot aforesaid within the corporate limits of the city of North Yakima aforesaiid, a complaint was filed by one Vestal Snyder, City Attorney of North Yakima, Washington, before one W. I. Lince, Police Judge of the city of North Yakima, charging your petitioner with violating an ordinance of the city of North Yakima,
or that part of an ordinance which reads as follows, to-wit:-

"Sec.7. Each hawker or peddler of goods, wares, and merchandise shall pay a license of $400.00 dollars per quarter provided that such license fee may be taken our for a term less than one quarter at the rate of $25.00 per day, and provided further that no person shall be required to take out a license for peddling newspapers, books, magainzes, fruit, breat, meat, milk, ice or other products of Yakima County."

That thereafter the petitioner was arrested and brought before the said Police Judge and upon a motion for a change of venue in behalf of the petitioner said cause was transferred to the Justice's Court of J.A.Taggard, Justice of the Peace in and for North Yakima Precinct, Yakima County, state of Washington. That thereupon a trial of said cause before said justice J.A.Taggard, the said J. A. Taggard did under said ordinance assess a fine against the petitioner in the sum of five dollars and the costs thereof, and did order and direct as part of his judgment that this petitioner should be committed to the custody of one John G. Boule, the city marshal of North Yakima aforesaid, until said fine and costs were paid, and your petitioner was accordingly taken into the custody of the said John G. Boyle under and by virtue of said order of commitment and is now in the custody of the said John G. Boyle under and by virtue of the judgment of the said J. A. Taggard and the said order of commitment made by the said justice in pursuance thereof That the said ordinance is null and void and is in violation of the constitution and laws of the United States in this to-wit; lst. The sum of $400.00 4s a license for three months is a prohibitive and unreasonable license as is also $25.00 per day as provided by said ordinance. That petitioner's profits from the sale of said medicine would never equal the amount of said licenses. That the effect of this is to prohibit him from doing business within the city of North Yakima, and infringes his right under the constitution of the United States to engage in business in North Yakima upon equal terms with the persons selling products of Yakima County and interferes with the right of commerce as guaranteed by the constitution of the United States between the citizens of the different states, and is therefore null and void. 2nd. That the said ordinance is in violation

of the constitution and laws of the United States in this, to- wit:- that the said ordinance discriminates against residents and citizens and products of all other portions of the United States in favor of the products and citizens of Yakima County, which is in violation of the constitutional right of the petitioner as a citizen of the state of Oregon, and which is in violation of the right of Congress to regulate commerce, and which is in violation of that potion of the constitution of the United States which gives to the citizens of each state of the union like privileges, rights and immunities in every other state in said union had by the citizens of such state; for which reason said ordinance is null and void.

WHEREFORE, your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus may be granted directed to the said John G. Boyle commanding him to have the body of your petitioner before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your Honor concerning him, together with the time and cause of petitioner's detention and said writ and that he may be restored to his liberty.
Dated on this 7th day of September, 1901.
div1.ab: State of Washington, County of Yakims
div1.p: F. S. Walton being first duly sworn by me said upon oath that he is the petitioner named in the foregoing petition that he has read the same, knows the contents thereof and that the same are true.
Taken, sworn to and subscribed before me this 5th day of September, A. D., 1901
div1.ab: Notary Public in and for the state of Washington, residing at North Yakima, Washington.
In the United States District Circuit Court, District of Washington, State Southern Division State of Washington
In the matter of the application of F. S. Walton - for a writ of Habeas Corpus

FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. SEP 7 1901 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk
RM Hopkins Dep.
